edu.ncsu.csc.itrust.dao.mysql

? OfficeVisitDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.itrust.dao.mysql.OfficeVisitDAO

  • public class OfficeVisitDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for doing tasks related to office visits. Use this for linking diagnoses to office visits, and similar tasks. DAO stands for Database Access Object. All DAOs are intended to be reflections of the database, that is, one DAO per table in the database (most of the time). For more complex sets of queries, extra DAOs are added. DAOs can assume that all data has been validated and is correct. DAOs should never have setters or any other parameter to the constructor than a factory. All DAOs should be accessed by DAOFactory (@see DAOFactory) and every DAO should have a factory - for obtaining JDBC connections and/or accessing other DAOs.
    ??:
    Andy
